byline.contributor: Kirk Johnson reported from Chelan, and Fernanda Santos from Phoenix. Motoko Rich contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By KIRK JOHNSON and FERNANDA SANTOS

abstract: Firefighters and communities in Washington State mourn deaths of Tom Zbyszewski, Richard Wheeler and Andrew Zajac, who were killed while fighting wildfires near town of Twisp; deaths shine light on occupation that has become riskier and less cohesive as fire threat grows.
lead_paragraph: The lives and deaths of Tom Zbyszewski, Richard Wheeler and Andrew Zajac offer a window into the close-knit world of wildland firefighting in the West.

headline.main: Three Killed in Washington Wildfire Are Mourned
headline.print_headline: Three Killed in Washington Wildfire Are Mourned

snippet: The lives and deaths of Tom Zbyszewski, Richard Wheeler and Andrew Zajac offer a window into the close-knit world of wildland firefighting in the West.
